description:
Traditionally, when a witch turns 15, she's supposed to go out into the world alone to study magic. Makoto's parents, however, believe that their directionally-challenged daughter should get a high school degree. Instead of being sent out on her own, Makoto and her cat Chito find themselves traveling from the bustling city of Yokohama to Aomori Prefecture, where they'll stay with relatives until Makoto finishes school. It's going to be a big adjustment, and it only gets more complicated since "normal" people aren't supposed to know that witches exist… something that she tends to forget.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Witch

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Shounen

node.description:
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
A Japanese arranger, composer, and member of the band [Jyukai](https://anilist.co/staff/100234/Jyukai).

__Raised:__ Tokyo, Japan 
__Height:__ 149 cm 
__Instruments:__ Guitar, piano 

__[Website](https://www.miwa-web.com/bio/) | [Blog (Line)](https://lineblog.me/miwa/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miwastaff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miwa_official_38/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC9cz0t8P3VkTHY7xjbS8zHA)__

Her debut single, “don’t cry anymore”, is being used as the theme song for the Fuji TV drama, Nakanai to Kimeta Hi, starring Eikura Nana.
